metadata.title: CVE-2020-14147 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
An integer overflow in the getnum function in lua_struct.c in Redis before6.0.3 allows context-dependent attackers with permission to run Lua code ina Redis session to cause a denial of service (memory corruption andapplication crash) or possibly bypass intended sandbox restrictions via alarge number, which triggers a stack-based buffer overflow. NOTE: thisissue exists because of a CVE-2015-8080 regression.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-14147` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

redis - 5:6.0.0-1
redis-sentinel - 5:6.0.0-1
redis-server - 5:6.0.0-1
redis-tools - 5:6.0.0-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: redis package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '5:6.0.0-1').
